description:
Yuuya Nomoto was horrified to discover that the vehicle he was driving was being used to kidnap a high school girl, but he's even more shocked when the girl, Hitomi Uzaki, literally tears her kidnappers to pieces instead! Then she forces Yuuya to drive her to an arena where she bets the value of his organs on herself to win in a death match against a half-lion hybrid! Even more astonishing: Hitomi wins! That's because she's a Therianthrope, a genetically engineered fighter created specifically for the underground death matches known as Killing Bites! And now that Yuuya has been pulled into this dark underworld, he has no choice but to continue working for Hitomi. Because who's going to fight against a girl who's part honey badger?

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

node.description:
__Place of Birth:__ Yokohama, Japan

[Website #1](http://www.geocities.jp/cool_shiya_com/) | [Website #2](http://jonjonjonjon.web.fc2.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/jojojon) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=359145)

Artist and designer.

__Gender:__ Male  
__Place of Birth:__ Maebashi, Gunma, Japan  
__Zodiac:__ Cancer    

[Official Website](http://pinkdrain.blog.fc2.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/s_kazasa)

fripSide is a Japanese indie pop band. Started in 2002. They also have many other support members.  

On March 15, 2009, nao stated on the fripSide Official Website that she had graduated from fripSide. Sat and nao want to pursue different musical careers, as nao intends to pursue a solo singing career. Meanwhile Sat will continue in fripSide with a new project called, fripside: THE NEXT PROJECT. Seiyuu Yoshino Nanjo took over as the vocalist of fripSide with her debut single "only my railgun", the opening of the anime, To Aru Kagaku no Railgun. 

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Members__
- sat - [Satoshi Yaginuma](https://anilist.co/staff/111757) (八木沼悟志) - (lyrics, synthesizers, composer, arrangement) (2002-present)
- Mao Uesugi (上杉真央) - (vocals) (2022-present)
- Hisayo Abe (阿部寿世) - (vocals) (2022-present)

__Former Members__
- [nao](https://anilist.co/staff/118365/nao) (vocal, lyrics) (2002-2009)
- [Yoshino Nanjo](https://anilist.co/staff/96592/Yoshino-Nanjo) (南條愛乃) - (vocals, lyrics) (2009-2022)
**Yokomatsu Norihiko (横松紀彦)** is a Japanese art director and background artist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田祐二) | [Studio Wyeth](https://www.studio-wyeth.jp/)

A prominent art director, as well as the founder and representative director of Studio Wyeth.

_Note: Not to be confused with animator [Yuuji Ikeda](https://anilist.co/staff/144426/)._

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).
